metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2327 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libavcodec/pngenc.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.5 uses incorrect line sizes in certain row calculations, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted .avi file, related to the apng_encode_frame and encode_apng functions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1').
